secret_rule: Only items that are typically found in a toolbox can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Hammer" and "Screwdriver".
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Wrench" to the game?
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Pliers" to the game?
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Saw" to the game?
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Drill" to the game?
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Tape Measure" to the game?
Yes, you can bring a "Tape Measure."
I think I have a good idea of the rule based on the conversation history. The items that can be brought seem to be tools. I would like to make a new guess: Can I bring a "Level" to the game?

Based on the examples and the game master's responses, it seems that the items you can bring to the game are tools. All the items listed—Hammer, Screwdriver, Wrench, Pliers, Saw, Drill, Tape Measure, and Level—are common tools used for construction or repair work. Therefore, it appears the rule is that the item must be a tool. My best guess for the rule is: "You can bring any item that is a tool commonly found in a toolbox or used for construction or repairs."
Correct! The rule is: Only items that are typically found in a toolbox can be brought to the picnic.
